events.description: What is QMUN? Queen’s Model United Nations is an annual MUN conference held at Queen’s University campus in Kingston, Ontario. 2018 will mark the 33rd year for QMUN, making it one of the longest running MUN conferences in Canada. QMUN is a non-profit student organized conference that brings together 150 delegates from all faculties at Queen’s, to participate in debate on international affairs. The theme of 2018 is "Global Development and Migration". 6 separate committees will debate sub-topics on the overarching theme over the 3 days of the conference. QMUN's second annual General Assembly will also be held this year. All 150 delegates will be brought together on the second day of debate to interact in a crisis style debate format. Participation at QMUN does not require prior experience at a model UN conference or membership in a MUN team! We welcome all delegates to attend! The size of the conference provides students with a more intimate and comprehensive debating experience to engage in discussion about pressing international issues and develop solutions while applying various global perspectives. The delegate fee will encompass attendance for an open ceremony wine and cheese, 3 days of debate, speeches from multiple keynote speakers, evening socials, a formal banquet dinner, and closing ceremonies and awards. Registration is first come first serve so apply now! Bursary Information The Campus Activities Commission Bursary is available to help subsidize the cost for delegates who wish to seek financial assistance. The CAC bursary can be found on the AMS website. Bursary applications must be submitted to cac@ams.queensu.ca by November 10th, at 5pm. Submitting a CAC bursary acts in the place of registration and will hold a spot for you until bursary applications are reviewed, at which time all applicants will be notified of their application status. Bursary applicants will receive a special registration link regardless of whether you are successfull or not - please do not complete the registration form at this time if you are applying for a bursary.  Why QMUN? Queen’s Model United Nations is an incredible weekend filled with opportunities to explore various world issues and come up with resolutions for each. It is an inclusive and enriching environment attracting students from various faculties. QMUN offers an exciting forum to familiarize students with international diplomacy and provide networking opportunities in an intra-university setting. FAQs Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? Caroline Tsambalieros (Delegate Coordinator): qmundelegates@ams.queensu.ca Abigail Marshal & Meredith Liang-He (QMUN co-chairs): qmun@ams.queensu.ca Do I need any experience in Model UN to particpate at QMUN? No! QMUN is a no-experience necessary conference that occurs at the end of January, 2018. Training sessions prior to the conference will prepare delegates on the proper parliamentary flow of debate at QMUN.  What is the time committment for QMUN? There will be several training sessions in November and January that delegates are expected to attend. These sessions will not exceed one hour. Apart from the training sessions, the delegates are expected to attend the 3 day conference beginning with an Open Ceremony at 6:00pm on January 25th and ending with a Closing Ceremony at 7:00pm on January 27th. Who can participate in QMUN? All undergraduate students from all faculties at Queen's University may participate in Queen's Model UN. QMUN is an internal university MUN conference and only students who hold valid Queen's Student ID's will be able to participate.

events.description: Join the iBIO Delegation for the BIO Fly-In and Connect with Industry Leaders and Policy Makers in Washington DC on April 17th and 18th. The annual fly-in is a free program and iBIO will provide travel stipends for Illinois startup companies interested in participating in the Capital Hill visits. Connect with Policy Makers The annual fly-in is a great opportunity for Illinois companies to engage with Members of Congress and their senior staff on the most important legislative issues facing the Illinois life sciences industry. All congressional meetings will be scheduled for attendees and  a robust legislative briefing will be provided prior to visits on Capitol Hill. iBIO will also host a private reception for Illinois delegates and our Members of Congress. Connect with Industry Leaders Between participating in the legislative briefing, walking the halls of Congress and networking at our welcome reception, there are numerous opportunities to meet fellow industry leaders and political officials from your own state and around the country. The Legislative Day Fly-In attracts over 300 attendees from nearly 40 states. Details Travel and hotel details will be posted soon!
events.title: iBIO Delegation: Washington DC Fly-In

events.description: CLIA are delighted to announce our inaugural Asia cruise event taking place from April 10 - 12. The conference itself will be followed by a short cruise on the Mekong river departing 12 April 2018 for 3 nights with Pandaw. Delegates will also take advantage of a trade fair and conference sessions which will focus on identifying potential cruise customers and learning more about the wide variety of experiences offered on a cruise holiday around Asia. Hotel The conference sessions will be held at the Le Meridien Saigon, the hotel has put together a booking link for hotel rooms for our conference delegates, the two night stay 10th & 11th April in Ho Chi Minh City is at delegates own arrangement and cost, you will receive this link once your registration is confirmed. Dinner Delegates will be hosted on both the 10th and 11th April for dinner, Scenic are looking forward to seeing you on the evening of the 10th and APT have a very special night planned with Luke Nguyen, APT Ambassador, acclaimed chef, author and television personality at his new restaurant on April 11th. Mekong Cruise As part of the event you will be hosted onboard a Mekong Cruise with Pandaw please see the itinerary as below: Pandaw will supply a transfer from the conference hotel on the 12/Apr at 10.00am to join the ship in My Tho. On the 15th Pandaw will include an excursion in the morning in Phnom Penh return delegates to the ship for lunch onboard. Disembarkation will take place after lunch around 14.00. DAY 1 MY THO (Ho Chi Minh City) Morning transfer from Saigon to embark on your Pandaw vessel in time for welcome drinks, a briefing and lunch. Sail across the vast Mekong Delta. Your guide will collect your passports at the meeting point so we can arrange the immigration formalities. DAY 2 SA DEC In the morning we will visit Cai Be floating market along canals and backwaters and then continue to Sa Dec via Vinh Long Province. Sa Dec has an interesting local market and the ancient house of Mr, Huyn Thuy Le, the 'lover' of Marguerite Duras, a famous French novelist whose book was immortalised in the film L’Indochine. DAY 3 CHAU DOC Visit a Moslem Cham tribal village and a cat fish farm in Chau Doc with our guide or do your own thing and take off on one of our mountain bikes. The local market is great and the Catholic Church well worth a visit. Return to the ship by boat for lunch and cast off for the Cambodian border for the usual formalities. DAY 4 PHNOM PENH After breakfast visit to the city. Lunch onboard. Disembark in Cambodia’s capital, Phnom Penh, after lunch. Cruise Price Includes: Entrance fees, guide services (English language), gratuities to crew, main meals, locally made soft drinks, local beer and local spirits, jugged coffee and selection of teas and tisanes, mineral water. Transfers from conference hotel in Saigon to ship. Cruise Price Excludes: International flights, laundry, all visa costs, imported beverages such as wines, premium spirits and liqueurs, fancy soft drinks like Perrier, espressos and cappuccinos at bar and tips to local guides and cyclo drivers. No transfers in Phnom Penh after disembarkation. Please note that the Mekong cruise section of the event is based on a twin share basis. If you are a single traveller you will be allocated on a same sex share basis however, if there is another registered Travel Agent you would like to cabin share with please let us know. Single cabins are strictly unavailable. Terms & Conditions – This event is available to CLIA Member Travel Agents ONLY. Travel Agent attendees are responsible for the arrangement and cost of their own flights to and from the event, accommodation in Ho Chi Minh City and any internal flights after the Mekong Cruise. Delegates are also responsible for their personal travel insurance and must check for the latest vaccination and Visa requirements for both Vietnam and Cambodia. Agents are also responsible for any expenditure when experiences are not covered by sponsors or the event. Registration for this unique experience is based on a first come, first serve basis. Registration for the event does not guarantee attendance at the event, this will be confirmed by CLIA. CLIA reserves the right to deny places at this event based on the terms and conditions provided. Confirmed agent places will be 100% guaranteed when flight booking information is received, this will need to be completed within 4 weeks of the confirmed registered place. All registrations are non refundable unless cancelled by CLIA.

artists.description: 1- Delegation is a disco band consisting of Ricky Bailey, Len Coley, Ray Patterson and Roddy Harris. They started their career in the late 70s with the singles «The Promise Of Love» and "Put A Little Love On Me". Later on, Delegation released the albums «Delegation», «Eau De Vie», «Delegation II», «Deuces High» and «Encore». Ricky Bailey & Delegation... delivering all that's great about British 70's, 80's & 90's Soulful Funk! Delegation one of the foremost recording and touring soul funk bands of the 70's, 80's and 90's with a string of chart hits in the UK, all over Europe and the US. The band that recorded "Where Is The Love" (We Used To Know) and featured on the then, leading music TV programme in the UK, "Top Of The Pops" which also arrived on UK screens on Thursday nights was the only TV place to be to catch the UK chart scene, in fact if you were going out you wouldn't go out until you had seen TOP! The Delegation Band from 2012 still has Mr Ricky Bailey at its heart. Ricky's zest for life, love and music is unrelenting and passionate. Still working hard at his craft with his soulful, rich vocals and masterful leadership... Ricky is a man with a mission and as he comments, "There's unfinished business". Great news for Delegation fans all over the world! To see what the band is up to now please visit DelegationBand on last.fm or the website www.delegationband.com Read more on Last.fm.
